about_department.description: The Morgan State University Computer Science Program is part of the School of Computer, Mathematics, and Natural Sciences. The program provides students with fundamental computer science knowledge and training, preparing them to apply their skills to solve real-world problems. Students learn problem definition, feasibility analysis, solution strategy development, design, implementation, testing, modification, documentation, and communication. The curriculum balances practical knowledge and theoretical foundations to support career readiness and adaptability in the evolving discipline.
degrees_offered: Bachelor of Science (BS) in Computer Science
Master of Science (MS) in Advanced Computing
Bachelor of Science (BS) in Cloud Computing
4+1 Bachelor’s and Master’s Program in Computer Science

academic_appeals_form.purpose: To appeal decisions made by the department chairpersons in SCMNS.
academic_appeals_form.required_form: The Department C.A.R.E.S. Form must be completed and reviewed by the Chairperson before completing this form.
academic_appeals_form.notes: Students can fill out this form if they have any issue with a grade or professor. Make sure to document and provide evidence

contact_information.address: 1700 E Cold Spring Lane, Baltimore, MD 21251, McMechen 507 Suite

faculty_and_staff.introduction:
The faculty and staff of the Morgan State University Computer Science Department are dedicated to advancing the field of computer science, guided by our mission to provide high-quality education and foster innovation through cutting-edge research. Our faculty members bring expertise from a wide range of research areas and are committed to supporting students in their academic and professional growth. During the Academic Advising Period, the Computer Science faculty serve as academic advisors for students in the department, assisting with course planning, registration, and providing necessary academic guidance. Students can find their academic advisors in their respective offices, and office hours are posted on the board in the Computer Science Suite, Room 507. Based on students' last names, they can easily locate the right advisor for their needs.

For office hours related to anyone in the Department of Computer Science, it’s best to check the syllabus for your professor’s specific office hours if you’re enrolled in their course. If you’re not taking a course or need further assistance, feel free to email them directly to inquire about their office hours and schedule an appointment—especially if you’d like to discuss something important. Office hours can change frequently, so this is the most reliable way to stay updated.

department_leadership.name: Shuangbao "Paul" Wang
department_leadership.title: Professor and Chair
department_leadership.research_interest: Focuses on quantum cryptography, secure architecture, AI and machine learning, IoT and cyber-physical systems, and video indexing.

department_leadership.name: Md Rahman
department_leadership.title: Professor, Associate Chair
department_leadership.research_interest: Concentrates on computer vision, image processing, information retrieval, machine learning, and data mining, applying these to extract relevant and actionable biomedical information for clinical and research purposes.

professors.name: Amjad Ali
professors.title: Professor
professors.research_interest: Specializes in cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, critical infrastructure security, security policy and privacy, BYOD security, smart cities security, mobile security, and cloud security.

professors.name: Radhouane Chouchane (Radwan Shushane)
professors.title: Associate Professor
professors.research_interest: Explores explainable artificial intelligence and machine learning to detect potentially malicious cyber activities.

professors.name: Monireh Dabaghchian
professors.title: Associate Professor
professors.research_interest: Researches cybersecurity, IoT security, cyber-physical systems security, privacy in spectrum-sharing networks, online learning algorithms, multi-armed bandits, statistical learning, artificial intelligence, and deep learning.

professors.name: Jamell Dacon
professors.title: Assistant Professor
professors.research_interest: Focuses on artificial intelligence, machine learning, computational social science, and natural language processing, with an emphasis on fairness and bias in AI/ML/NLP, human-computer interaction, data science for social good, and AI applications in education, healthcare, accessibility for people with disabilities, and criminal justice.

professors.name: Mohamed Eltoweissy
professors.title: Professor, Associate Dean for Research and Graduate Programs
professors.research_interest: Research focuses on network security, cryptography, distributed systems, and applied machine learning.

professors.name: Jin Guo
professors.title: Professor of Practice
professors.research_interest: Specializes in cloud computing, enterprise IT architecture, and IT management.

professors.name: Vahid Heydari
professors.title: Associate Professor
professors.research_interest: Investigates moving target defense, security and privacy in industrial control systems, wireless networks, wearable medical devices, IoT, malware analysis, machine learning, and zero-trust architectures.

professors.name: Naja Mack
professors.title: Assistant Professor
professors.research_interest: Researches human-centered computing, artificial intelligence, machine learning, adaptive learning technologies, conversational user interfaces, computer science education, broadening participation in computing, virtual reality, robotics, and social media data analytics.

professors.name: Jianzhou Mao
professors.title: Research Assistant Professor
professors.research_interest: Focuses on machine learning, deep learning, and AI applications in big data analytics and optimization.

professors.name: Blessing Ojeme
professors.title: Assistant Professor
professors.research_interest: Explores artificial intelligence, machine learning (theory and algorithms), deep learning, image processing, computer vision, bioinformatics, human-computer interaction, and information storage and retrieval.

professors.name: Roshan Paudel
professors.title: Coordinator of the MS in Bioinformatics Program, Professor of Practice
professors.research_interest: Specializes in high-performance computing, bioinformatics, next-generation sequencing analysis, computational biology, and computational modeling, with a primary interest in developing stochastic models of calcium and ion channels in cardiac myocytes.

professors.name: Eric Sakk
professors.title: Associate Professor
professors.research_interest: Focuses on dynamical systems, machine learning, system theory, computer systems, communications systems, and bioinformatics.

professors.name: Vojislav Stojkovic
professors.title: Associate Professor
professors.research_interest: Investigates bioinformatics (bioalgorithms and bioprogramming), cybersecurity, information assurance, artificial intelligence (agents and multiagent systems), formal languages (grammars and automata), programming languages, compiler/interpreter design, parallel and distributed computing, quantum and DNA computing, data science techniques, and machine learning.

professors.name: Timothy Oladunni
professors.title: Assistant Professor
professors.research_interest: Expert in artificial intelligence, with a focus on natural language processing, computer vision, data science, and pattern recognition.

professors.name: Guobin Xu
professors.title: Associate Professor
professors.research_interest: Research interests include machine learning, computer vision, robotics, and the development of intelligent systems for healthcare applications.

engineers_in_residence.description: Every Fall Semester, there is a Google Engineer in Residence through the Google in Residence (GIR) program. Launched in 2013, this program aims to increase diversity in the tech industry by partnering with Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) and Hispanic-Serving Institutions (HSIs). Experienced Googlers teach introductory computer science courses and provide career guidance.

research_areas: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning / Deep Learning

student_organizations.name: Women In Computer Science (WiCS)
student_organizations.mission: Supporting and empowering female students in computer science through networking, mentorship, and community building.

student_organizations.name: Google Developer Student Club (GDSC)
student_organizations.description: A student-run organization supported by Google that bridges the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world application in technology.

student_organizations.name: Society for the Advancement of Computer Science (SACS)
student_organizations.mission: Promoting the advancement of computer science through discussions, technical events, and industry collaboration.
